Chelsea are discussing the possibility of a post-season tour, a move that could upset numerous international managers. Jose Mourinho didn't rule out a potential 12,000-mile round trip to Japan, home of new sponsors Yokohama Rubber, . No final decision has been made on a destination but if a tour goes ahead, the squad is likely to fly out on either May 28 or 29 for a two-match, week-long trip. Jose Mourinho did not rule out the prospect of a 12,000-mile round trip for a pre-season tour in Japan . The news may concern a string of international bosses who will be relying on Chelsea players for their mid-June friendlies and qualifiers. For instance, Belgium face France in a friendly on June 7 before a vital Euro 2016 qualifier against Wales on June 12. England, Spain and Serbia, who all have Chelsea players in their squads, all have games between June 12-14. Likewise, the proposed tour would also have implications for Chelsea's South American contingent, including Oscar, Willian and Juan Cuadrado, ahead of the Copa America on June 11. FIFA rules state that nations are entitled to players 14 days before the start of a tournament. It is highly likely that those players involved in the Copa America would be given permission to miss Chelsea's post-season tour. Chelsea are yet to finalise plans for their pre-season as they lead the way at the top of the Premier League . Mourinho said: 'I think we'll go on an after-season tour to play a couple of matches in some destination where people will be very enthusiastic to have the Premier League champions, if we win it. 'It's something we are thinking about, a good way to celebrate. Not a victory parade, but a trip, a week where we play a couple of matches but, at the same time, can be together without the pressure of winning every match, without the pressure and tension of the last weeks of the Premier League. 'We can also relax and go to holidays with that good feeling. But we still have nine matches to play. 'Mr Bruce Buck and the board are talking with me. We want to go somewhere where people are enthusiastic to have a club like Chelsea. 'Japan? I don't know but that would make some sense.'

Jordan Spieth holds command at 2015 Masters as Rory McIlroy and Tiger Woods falter The 2015 Masters saw an inspired performance from young American golfer Jordan Spieth, who held onto a significant lead over seasoned opponents Rory McIlroy and Tiger Woods. As the competition progressed, it was clear that 21-year-old Spieth was the one to watch, as he consolidated and extended his control over the famous Augusta course in resolute fashion. From the beginning, it appeared to be anyone's game, with McIlroy and Woods both making strong starts. However, they were no match for a determined Spieth, who, despite his young age, demonstrated his considerable prowess on the green. At the age of just 21, Spieth is one of the youngest golfers ever to have won the Masters. His single-minded focus and unyielding determination to succeed saw him raise the coveted Green Jacket, beating the odds in the process. While McIlroy and Woods were both early favorites, it was Spieth who ultimately emerged as the true champion. As he addressed the crowd after his victory, there was no denying the outpouring of both emotion and relief: "I'm at a loss for words," he said. "This is the most incredible week of my life. This is as great as it gets in the sport. It was very nerve-wracking today. I thought today might be a bit easier than it was." The 2015 Masters will certainly go down as an event that showcased the best of the sport, with Spieth's remarkable performance proving that, sometimes, tenacity and drive can overshadow even the most experienced and decorated of opponents. Looking ahead, as Spieth continues to cement his status as one of the world's best golfers, it's clear we can expect great things from this young talent, both on and off the course. As Rory McIlroy congratulated Spieth on his victory, he summed up the sentiment felt by many: "It's a special moment for him, but I've got a feeling it's not going to be his last."

Hollywood has made a lot of strange movies over the years, but none stranger than this. WHY this movie got made I will never know, nor how Paramount could have thought it would sell any tickets in 1947. It is the strangest mix of genres I have seen in a long time, a movie that truly does not know whether it is trying to be a serious war drama or a Viennese operetta comedy.It tells the story of a British spy trying to get a poison gas formula out of Germany in the days just before WW II began. Ray Milland, a fine actor, is stuck playing the part like an escapee from Monty Python, all very exaggerated English prep-school dialogue. In Germany he meets a gypsy, Marlene Dietrich, who helps him to travel under cover as, of course, another gypsy. She plays her part like the typical Viennese operetta gypsy caricature, as do the other "gypsies" in the movie. But there are also Nazis, who are not funny at all. And then Milland finds he is starting to think like a gypsy, and that is not treated as a joke. Sometimes the music is for a light comedy, sometimes for a drama. Every time the Nazis show up, the film score plays Wagner, which is funny by itself.This movie could have been a comedy, or it could have taken the plight of the gypsies seriously and done a serious job of showing how the Nazis treated them. Both are hinted at in this movie, but neither pursued. What we are left with is a truly strange mish-mash of genres that must have embarrassed everyone (except the director) involved.Bizarre.

Holy Schnikey! "The Marvelous Misadventures of Marvin" truly takes audiences on a wild ride they won't forget. This vibrant and whimsical film introduces the quirky and lovable character Marvin, played by rising star, James Thornley. As Marvin finds himself entangled in a series of mishaps and extraordinary happenings, Thornley's performance brings humor and heart to every scene. The cinematography is breathtaking, seamlessly capturing the film's diverse array of landscapes and settings. Director Simon Richardson has managed to create an enchanting and immersive world for audiences to dive into. One truly feels like they're on the tumultuous journey with Marvin himself. Equally impressive is the film's delightful supporting cast, showcasing exceptional chemistry and brilliantly timed comedic beats. Each character is unique and well-developed, drawing viewers in and leaving them eager for more. The film's score is another standout, perfectly capturing the essence of Marvin's misadventures. The playful and enchanting melodies sweep audiences along as the story unfolds, striking just the right balance between whimsy and sentimentality. In conclusion, "The Marvelous Misadventures of Marvin" is an absolute triumph - an entertaining, engaging, and visually stunning cinematic experience that will capture the hearts of viewers young and old. Do yourself a favor and don't miss the opportunity to join Marvin on his spectacular journey. Your inner child will thank you.

Turkish football suspended for one week after team bus attack After an armed attack on a football team bus occurred on Saturday, football in Turkey has been suspended for one week. Fenerbahce's team bus came under fire as it made its way to Trabzon airport following their 5-1 victory against Caykur Rizespor. Two people have been detained by the police regarding the incident. The attack on the bus left the driver injured, and the bus heavily damaged. Images from the incident show multiple bullet holes in the front windshield and a shattered window next to the steering wheel. According to Fenerbahce vice-president Mahmut Uslu, the driver's quick thinking of diving after being shot to lie down saved his life. The suspension of football activities was announced by the Turkish Football Federation, with the president, Yildirim Demiroren, stating that all forms of football had been suspended for a week - leagues, national team games, and international club competitions. He added that everyone involved in the sport in Turkey is saddened by the incident, and he hopes that it serves as a turning point, teaching everyone how violence is not the answer. The detentions followed an extensive search for the people behind the attack, with police scouring the Surmene district where the shooters were located when they fired at the bus. The authorities say that they found 7.65-millimeter-diameter cartridges used in automatic weapons at the scene. The Turkish Prime Minister, Ahmet Davutoglu, has pledged to apprehend the people behind the attack, calling it "an attack against the national will." He added that the full force of the law would be used against all perpetrators.

Manchester United duo Marcos Rojo and Angel di Maria celebrated their 3-1 triumph over Aston Villa by flying out to Lisbon on Easter Sunday. United defender Rojo uploaded an image of himself posing alongside fellow Argentina international Di Maria and their families while sitting on a private plane. Rojo, who sat next to his wife and daughter, played the full 90 minutes against Villa while Premier League record signing Di Maria came on for the last 20. Marcos Rojo (back right) poses while travelling to Portugal along with his family and Angel di Maria (left) Both Rojo (left) and Di Maria (right) appeared in Manchester United's 3-1 win over Aston Villa on Saturday . The Manchester United and Argentina duo sealed moves to Old Trafford during the summer transfer window . Portugal is a familiar destination for both Rojo and Di Maria as they played for Sporting Lisbon and Benfica respectively before eventually joining United in the summer. Rojo made headlines for the wrong reasons on Saturday evening as the Mail On Sunday exclusively revealed he had an affair with fitness instructor Sarah Watson. She claimed Rojo had offered money to spend the night with him before eventually sleeping with the 25-year-old without knowing he was married with a young daughter. The 200,000-a-week Manchester United defender is said to have bombarded her with explicit messages and naked photos. Sarah Watson was determined to clear her name following blackmail allegations . Watson claims she was offered money to spend the night with Rojo (right) but declined . Watson claims she was offered 35,000 by a newspaper to sell the story about her affair with Rojo . She said on meeting Rojo at United's Christmas party: 'He came over to me and sat down. His English was quite bad but he was chatty and said nice things to me about how I looked and how he liked my Versace dress. 'He said "You're gorgeous, you're the best looking girl in here." It was all very cheesy, but he's so good looking that I gave him my number. 'He asked me how much it would cost for me to have sex with Marcos. I told him that I was not a prostitute.' But she did find the Argentine star's dusky looks attractive and they ended up in a bedroom. 'I did it because I liked him, not for money or with any intention to sell the story on,' she says. Rojo and Di Maria are not back in action until next Sunday when Manchester United host local rivals Manchester City.

Steve Bruce has promised his wife Janet he will go on a diet after unflattering paparazzi pictures of him on a Barbados beach were publicised. The Hull manager says he was 'disappointed' that the pictures were published and that he was baffled that anyone would be interested. Steve Bruce was looking larger than life after being snapped holidaying in Barbados with Alan Shearer . Bruce has promised his wife Janet he will slim down after seeing the unflattering snaps . Bruce was baffled that anyone would be interested in pictures of a 55-year-old on a beach . 'I don't think too many 55-year-olds look that good on a beach do they,' he said, 'but I have promised my good lady I will go on a diet. 'So watch out - I'm going to turn into the horriblest, most awkward bd you have ever come across. 'I have had some letters saying it's nice to see someone relaxing in their own skin - not many mind!' Bruce also had an appetite for the debate about how Premier League clubs should do more to bring through English talent. FA chairman Greg Dyke recently outlined new proposals, including increasing the number on homegrown players in a squad of 25 to 12, in effort to improve the national team. And Bruce agreed with Dyke, before going on to question how his former club Manchester United, along wide Liverpool and Manchester City, recruit players. Bruce fells his former club Manchester United should do more to produce young English players . He said: 'It is a great debate. We have the Premier League which is a wonderful spectacle but we have to find a way to produce young players and we have one or two, but we would like a lot more. 'One thing that is staggering over the last 20 years is that we have invested millions in academies but are we producing enough players? 'When you look back, where are they? It is a hell of a debate. For me personally, we miss children playing football at school. 'If you are going to do a job properly, you have to look at the football club as a whole and see if we can produce a younger player.'

Different drugs are recommended for the treatment of fibromyalgia by different published guidelines, although only three of them have been approved for this indication by the US FDA, and none have been approved by the European Medicines Agency. According to the available evidence, pregabalin, duloxetine and milnacipran should be the drugs of choice for the treatment of this disease, followed by amitriptyline and cyclobenzaprine. Other drugs with at least one positive clinical trial include some selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors, moclobemide, pirlindole, gabapentin, tramadol, tropisetron, sodium oxybate and nabilone. None of the currently available drugs are fully effective against the whole spectrum of fibromyalgia symptoms, namely pain, fatigue, sleep disturbances and depression, among the most relevant symptoms. Combination therapy is an option that needs to be more thoroughly investigated in clinical trials.

Scar Booth: The App that Glamorizes Violence or Just Harmless Fun? A new smartphone app called Scar Booth has sparked widespread criticism for its ability to superimpose bruises, cuts, and other injuries onto users' selfies. The app, which boasts that your friends will think you've suffered a "painful beating," has been slammed by anti-violence and abuse charities for glorifying violence and making light of the suffering endured by countless victims. Scar Booth, available for download on both iOS and Android platforms, offers a range of realistic-looking injuries that users can apply to their selfies, including bloody noses, black eyes, and severe cuts. As a result, the app has drawn backlash from several organizations advocating against violence and supporting victims of abuse. "It is absolutely disgusting that an app like this is being allowed to promote violence in such a nonchalant and trivial manner," said Emma Watson, a spokesperson for an anti-domestic violence charity. "It makes a mockery of the terrible experiences faced by thousands of people who have suffered physical abuse at the hands of their loved ones or have survived violent attacks." Critics argue that Scar Booth not only glamorizes violence but also normalizes it to a certain extent, potentially contributing to an already growing culture of violence in our society. They also believe that the app's seemingly lighthearted approach might encourage impressionable youths to participate in violent behavior or to view violent images as entertaining or socially acceptable. The app's developers argue that Scar Booth is not designed to promote violence but rather to offer users an opportunity to engage in a fun and harmless activity. The creators maintain that the intention behind the app is to allow users to pull harmless pranks on their friends or to create dramatic images for film or stage makeup enthusiasts. However, this explanation has failed to satisfy the app's detractors, who claim that the potential for harm far outweighs any lighthearted benefits it might provide. "As an organization that works with countless survivors of abuse, we know firsthand the emotional and physical scars that violent incidents can leave behind," said Samantha Ruiz of the National Coalition Against Domestic Violence. "It is deeply troubling that an app like this exists, seemingly trivializing the suffering of so many victims who are struggling to rebuild their lives." Despite the ongoing controversy and the calls for the app's removal from various app stores, Scar Booth remains available for download. It remains to be seen whether its popularity will wane as a result of the backlash or if users will continue to see it as a harmless form of entertainment. Regardless of the app's ultimate fate, the debate surrounding Scar Booth raises serious questions about our society's relationship with violence and the role that technology and social media play in shaping our perceptions of what is acceptable and what is not. In light of recent events, it could be beneficial for the tech industry to examine the potential impact of such applications on our society and consider adopting more stringent guidelines to prevent the promotion and normalization of violence in future apps and social media platforms.

By retaining the intact olecranon by the TRAP approach, orthopedic surgeon can get adequate surgical exposure for fracture fixation and can use olecranon as a three-dimensional template to restore the articular fragments. The promising results in this study obtain because that precise identification of the triceps muscle allowed the determination of a proper length-tension relationship for triceps reattachment. The combination of triceps tendon repair and anconeous muscle repair ensured the strength of the extensor mechanism. Therefore, the TRAP approach in combination with the usage of the precontoured locking plate can be recommended as the optimal surgical approach for the treatment of comminuted distal humerus fracture.

Yes, chronic exposure of human mesangial cells to high glucose environments can activate the p38 MAPK pathway. Several studies have demonstrated that high glucose levels induce activation of the p38 MAPK pathway in mesangial cells, leading to cell proliferation, extracellular matrix accumulation, and production of inflammatory mediators, which are all pathological changes associated with diabetic nephropathy. Therefore, the p38 MAPK pathway is considered a potential target for the development of novel therapeutic interventions for diabetic nephropathy.

Arsenal's Calum Chambers has proved his worth on the field since signing for 16 million from Southampton back in July 2014. The 20-year-old has made 36 appearances for the Gunners so far this season and sees his club and international future playing centre back. Chambers has really adapted to the role as both a right-back and centre-back since joining Arsenal and has performed exceptionally well when called upon. He played a crucial part in Arsenal's 4-1 win against Liverpool last week and recently earned his first England cap against Norway in September 2014. Arsene Wenger has been impressed with the young talent and believes he has a bright future ahead. In a recent interview, Wenger talked highly of Chambers saying, "I must say Calum has done extremely well. The fact that he can play in those two positions, at this level, and can be efficient and reliable defensively, very few people can do it, and he can do it." Arsenal fans will be excited to see if Chambers will continue his good run of form as the Gunners face Reading in the FA Cup semi-finals on Saturday evening. A win would put Arsenal through to the final and potentially a record 12th FA Cup title.

If you watched Pulp Fiction, don't see this movie. Titled 'Pulp Illusion,' this disappointing knock-off fails to capture the electrifying essence of Tarantino's cult classic. Despite attempts to recreate the complex narrative structure and witty dialogue that made Pulp Fiction unforgettable, 'Pulp Illusion' is nothing more than a poorly executed imitation that should be avoided by fans and casual viewers alike. The characters in 'Pulp Illusion' lack depth and charisma, making it impossible for the audience to invest in their fates. The plotline is convoluted, and not in the clever, post-modernist way Tarantino managed to accomplish. Instead, viewers will find themselves lost in a maze of confounding events and half-baked ideas that never come together in a satisfying manner. Moreover, the film's stilted dialogue and forced humor are a far cry from Pulp Fiction's sharp wit and memorable exchanges. 'Pulp Illusion' attempts to mimic Tarantino's iconic style, but ultimately delivers a series of cliched one-liners and cringe-inducing scenes that quickly become tiresome. Lastly, the cinematography and editing are subpar, lacking the artistry and flair that were so meticulously crafted in the original film. The action sequences fall flat and are riddled with unrealistic stunts and awkward choreography. It's clear that the creative team behind 'Pulp Illusion' does not possess the skill or vision to pay proper homage to the original film. In conclusion, if you're a fan of Pulp Fiction, do yourself a favor and avoid 'Pulp Illusion' at all costs. It's a glaring example of how cheap imitations fail to live up to their source material, tarnishing the reputation of a classic film while providing no entertainment value of their own.

Yes, small intestinal transit time can be delayed in Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth (SIBO). SIBO is a condition where there is an excessive amount of bacteria in the small intestine, which can lead to various symptoms, such as bloating, abdominal pain, diarrhea, and nutrient malabsorption. Delayed small intestinal transit time refers to the slowed movement of food and waste through the small intestine. This delay can be caused by various factors, including alterations in gut motility, alterations in gut neurotransmitters, or nerve damage. When transit time is delayed, bacteria in the small intestine have more time to overgrow, ferment undigested food, and cause inflammation, which can further exacerbate the symptoms of SIBO. In some cases, treating SIBO may involve addressing the underlying factors causing delayed small intestinal transit time, such as specific medications to improve gut motility or addressing underlying conditions like diabetes or scleroderma that can contribute to slowed transit time.

Thanks for the suggestion!

Thyroid hormone induces a UV (SWS1) -to-blue (SWS2) opsin switch in the retina of young salmonid fishes that is identical with that occurring during natural development. The switch occurs in differentiated photoreceptors, is reversible (maintained by thyroid hormone exposure), and can be induced only before its natural onset. Thyroid hormone did not cause changes in the number of proliferating cells in the ONL. These results conform to the dynamics of thyroid hormone-induced opsin expression in the mouse and are consistent with the opsin plasticity found in differentiated photoreceptors of the fruit fly, Drosophila melanogaster. This work establishes a role for thyroid hormone in triggering opsin switches in the vertebrate retina.

Person1: Hi Leah, how can I help you today? Person2: I'm calling to inform you about an upcoming event we're organizing for all international students. It's a networking session and cultural exchange, and we believe it would be a great opportunity for you to meet fellow students and share experiences. Person1: That sounds interesting! When is the event scheduled? Person2: The event is scheduled for next Friday, from 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM. It'll be held at the university's main hall. We'll also have some food and beverages from different countries to enjoy during the session. Person1: I'd love to attend! Do I need to bring anything or prepare beforehand? Person2: We encourage you to bring any cultural items or clothing that represent your country, if you have any. This way, everyone can learn something about each other's culture. Other than that, just bring yourself and an open mind! Person1: Great, I'll definitely be there. Thank you for inviting me! Person2: You're welcome, Nathaniel. We look forward to seeing you there. Have a great day! Person1: You too, Leah! Bye!

Dramatic Proposal Gone Wrong on 'The Jeremy Kyle Show' A heart-wrenching scene unfolded on the popular ITV talk show, "The Jeremy Kyle Show" when a man named Jamie proposed to his girlfriend Dawn, only for her to react by throwing the diamond ring at him and storming off in tears. The drama did not end there, as Dawn later shockingly revealed that she had been cheating on him. The episode, entitled "My fiance is a womaniser but is he a cheat?" aired on ITV during its weekday slot at 9.25 am. As the title suggests, the show is known for bringing personal relationship dramas to life in front of the cameras, but nothing could have prepared viewers for the gut-wrenching scene that unfolded during this particular broadcast. During the show, host Jeremy Kyle presented a seemingly heartfelt moment when Jamie got down on one knee to propose to his girlfriend Dawn while the couple tried to work out their relationship troubles. Jamie expressed his love and dedication to Dawn in front of the audience, hoping that a surprise proposal would help to mend their strained relationship. However, the fairy-tale ending that Jamie envisioned quickly turned into a nightmare when Dawn unexpectedly threw the diamond ring back at him and stormed off the stage in tears. The cameras then cut to Dawn backstage, where she shockingly revealed that she had been unfaithful during their relationship. This revelation added a surprising twist to the heartache, as it had been Jamie who was initially accused of cheating. Throughout the episode, Dawn claimed that her boyfriend was a womanizer and the couple had appeared on the show to determine whether or not he was cheating on her. The audience and the host were left stunned by the turn of events, as the chaotic and emotionally-charged episode came to an end. While it is uncertain where the couple's relationship stands after this tumultuous proposal, fans of "The Jeremy Kyle Show" will no doubt continue to watch in anticipation of the next drama to unfold on ITV's hit morning talk show.

Man Shoots Girlfriend Following Lottery Dispute, Ends in Double Tragedy In a tragic turn of events, Terry Martin, 48, fatally shot his girlfriend Laurice Hampton on Saturday following a heated dispute regarding their lottery ticket winnings. Hampton managed to call 911 to report the shooting just moments before her death. Officers responding to the 911 call found the couple inside a master bedroom where Martin was already dead, presumably from suicide. Hampton, still clinging to life, was rushed to a local hospital by ambulance, but sadly succumbed to her injuries hours later. The couple had allegedly been arguing over the proceeds from a lottery ticket they had won together. Authorities have not released any information about the amount of the winnings, but the heated argument escalated to the point of fatal violence. Friends and family of the couple are in shock and mourning over the senseless double tragedy. One friend described Terry and Laurice as a "loving couple," and no one saw this tragic outcome coming. As the investigation continues, authorities are working to develop a clearer timeline of events leading up to the deadly dispute. The incident serves as a grim reminder of the dangers of heated disputes, as well as the potentially devastating consequences that can come from the immense pressure generated by sudden financial gains.

Our findings indicated that OATP 1B1 A388G polymorphism has a notable influence on the serum bilirubin level in neonatal hyperbilirubinemia patients. The OATP 1B1 521T allele may be a potential risk factor of such disease. OATP 1B1 T521CA388G was an important polymorphism gene which related with neonatal hyperbilirubinemia. Future study should involve other polymorphisms of OATP 1B1, more candidate genes and environmental risk factors. It is also necessary to investigate their association with the severity and prognosis of this disease in order to elucidate the genetic pathogenesis of neonatal hyperbilirubinemia as a complex disease. This study should be repeated in a larger population and different ethnic groups.

Patients with underlying SIBO have significant delays in SBTT as compared with those without. The association between prolonged SBTT and positive LBT may be useful in identifying those patients with SIBO diagnosed by LBT and potentially target therapeutic options for those refractory to standard therapy. Interestingly, patients with positive LBT did not necessarily have a generalized gastrointestinal motility (similar GETs among groups), suggesting that small bowel transit specifically predisposes to the development of SIBO. Future, prospective studies are needed to further characterize intestinal dysmotility and other contributing pathophysiological mechanisms in SIBO and to investigate the potential benefits of prokinetics in this challenging patient population.

Kevin Pietersen re-signs for Surrey in hopes of England recall Former England cricketer Kevin Pietersen has re-signed for Surrey in a bid to earn a recall to the national side. He announced his return to the county cricket team on Twitter, stating he will make his return to batting for Surrey on Monday. Pietersen, who is currently in Dubai for a cricket commentators' stint, tweeted on Friday: "Can't wait to get back to surreycricket on Monday!" While it's unclear if he will be able to make an immediate impact on his return, Pietersen has regularly expressed his desire to represent England again. However, his chances of an England recall remain slim, with coach Peter Moores having previously said Pietersen "isn't on the radar" for the national team. The 39-year-old batsman has not played for England since 2014, when he was dropped from the side following a disastrous Ashes tour in Australia. Pietersen will hope to impress in the domestic circuit with a strong showing for Surrey, in the hope that it could open the door to a possible England comeback. He has amassed 8,181 Test runs in his 104-match career and has made no secret of his desire to add to that tally in an England shirt. Surrey fans will be delighted with the return of one of their favorite players, who first joined the club in 2010 and has made sporadic appearances over the years. In addition to his international exploits, Pietersen has been a prolific run-scorer in domestic T20 cricket, representing numerous franchises around the world. It remains to be seen whether Pietersen's return to Surrey will be enough to force his way back into the England setup. However, with a wealth of experience and a proven track record on the biggest stage, he will certainly provide a boost to Surrey's ambitions in the upcoming season. While it's unclear if he will be able to make an immediate impact on his return, Pietersen has regularly expressed his desire to represent England again.

I found it charming! The movie not only exceeded my expectations but also managed to address some serious themes without losing its delightful essence. The protagonists have a captivating chemistry that keeps you hooked, while the witty banter and heartfelt dialogues genuinely make you care for the characters. Visually, the movie is a treat, with gorgeous cinematography and stunning locations that further enhance the plot. The beautiful color palette and the seamless blend of fantasy and reality make it a delightful journey from start to finish. Moreover, the director's clever use of symbolism throughout the film gives it a depth that warrants multiple viewings. The original score adds to the movie's charm with its upbeat and soothing melodies that aptly set the mood for every scene. Furthermore, the soundtrack boasts an eclectic mix of well-curated songs that fittingly complement the story. As for the acting, the ensemble cast delivers a powerhouse of performances, encapsulating the vulnerability and strength of the characters. The supporting actors, too, play their roles with impeccable timing, providing the perfect amount of humor and emotion when needed. While the film's pacing may have its highs and lows, the overall narrative is engaging, and the well-placed twists ensure that you stay invested in the story. It's not often that a movie can make you laugh, cry and think at the same time, and this one does it all effortlessly. In conclusion, this movie is a refreshing, enchanting, and insightful experience wrapped in a beautiful package. One would surely not want to miss out on such a unique and uplifting cinematic gem.

I give this movie a 4 cause I'm a die-hard fan of the video game series. Having played the games for years, I had high expectations going into this film adaptation. Though it didn't live up to the complete thrill and detailed storytelling of the original video games, it managed to capture the essence of the gaming experience in a way that was visually stunning and captivating. The acting was solid, and I appreciate that the filmmakers stayed true to the spirit of the game's characters, which made it feel more authentic. The action-packed sequences were well-executed and drew me in, keeping the adrenaline pumping throughout the movie. The CGI effects were also impressively realistic, effectively transporting viewers to the familiar virtual realms. However, the plot fell somewhat short and could have benefited from a more robust and intricate story arc. At times, it felt like the focus on the action sequences took away from the storytelling, leading to a less emotionally engaging experience. The pacing was also a bit uneven in some parts, making it feel rushed in areas where it should have given more time to build tension and suspense. Overall, fans of the video game series will surely find something to enjoy in this adaptation while newcomers may feel a little lost amidst the action and gamer jargon. It's definitely worth a watch for its homage to the source material, as it manages to stay true to its roots.

Aston Villa prodigy Jack Grealish has attracted the attention of both the Republic of Ireland and England, leading to a heated debate over his international future. However, Villa manager Tim Sherwood has urged the 19-year-old to focus on playing more games for Villa in the meantime. Grealish, who was born in Birmingham, qualifies to represent both nations due to his Irish grandparents. He has previously played for Ireland at under-17, under-18 and under-21 levels, but has yet to make a senior international appearance. Irish manager Martin O'Neill is especially eager to secure the talents of Grealish, stating that he would love for the young star to play for the Irish national team. However, England manager Roy Hodgson is also reportedly keen on recruiting Grealish. Tim Sherwood, who managed Grealish during his time at Villa, has stressed that the midfielder's main concern should be securing more playing time at the club level and not rushing into a decision regarding his international future. "For Jack, it's just about playing football matches. He needs to play more games," Sherwood said. Grealish has decided to make a decision over his international future at the end of the season, giving him ample time to prove himself on the field for Villa. Fans of both the Irish and English national teams will be eagerly awaiting his decision, as the talented youngster continues to show promise in his fledgling career.

Using both RNA sequencing and real time PCR, we examined the association of STAT5A and STAT5B mRNA expression with CYP and TF gene expression. While STAT5A demonstrated significant negative correlations with expression levels of multiple hepatic TFs (including NR1I2 and HNF4) and CYPs (eg. CYP3A4, CYP2C19), STAT5B expression was observed to demonstrate positive association with most of the CYPsTFs analyzed suggesting that STAT5A and STAT5b have potentially different and distinct roles in regulating expression of hepatic drug response genes. Further studies are needed to elucidate the potential roles of STAT5A and 5b in regulation of CYPsTFs and the potential implications of these findings.

A recent poll has found that 45 of Britons have lied about their spending habits to their partner, highlighting the issues surrounding financial transparency in relationships. The same study also discovered that one in four Britons do not fully disclose how much they spend on themselves. In response to these findings, experts from the Money Advice Service are urging couples to have more open conversations about their finances. The poll, conducted by OnePoll, surveyed 1,000 adults across the UK and revealed that people are avoiding discussing money with their significant other for fear of causing arguments or embarrassment. The ongoing lockdowns may have intensified these concerns, as many households face increasingly strained budgets due to furloughs and job losses. The Money Advice Service has emphasised the importance of trust and financial transparency within relationships. "Finances should not be a taboo subject, and being open about money can help to avoid needless stress and strain on a relationship," urged a spokesperson for the service. The study also noted that 26 of those surveyed admitted to having secret stashes of cash hidden from their partner, while 22 confessed to using hidden bank accounts to cover their spending. The Money Advice Service suggests that couples take time to establish a financial plan together in order to reduce potential arguments and build trust. Additionally, the service recommends setting financial goals as a couple, establishing boundaries on shared expenses, regularly reviewing household budgets, and having frequent, open discussions about money. Experts argue that couples who maintain a strong level of financial transparency often enjoy healthier relationships and are less likely to encounter conflicts over money matters. "Being honest about your finances with your partner can help to identify and work towards joint and individual goals, while avoiding any potential mistrust in the future," said a spokesperson for the Money Advice Service. As the ongoing pandemic continues to impact economic stability for households across the UK, it is crucial for couples to work together to successfully manage their finances and ensure trust and honesty prevail in their relationships.

The Mod Squad gets started 'after' the formation of the 'Mod Squad' without even bothering to develop any of the characters or show us why anyone is doing what they are doing. Moreover, most of the events in the movie seem ancillary to the plot. This lack of backstory and development leaves the audience with little to no emotional investment in the characters, making it difficult to root for them or care about the outcome of the story. The acting is subpar, as the cast seems disconnected from the poorly-written dialogue and their characters' motivations. It seems that even the stars of the show don't have a clear understanding of the script, resulting in wooden and uninspired performances. Visually, the film does little to engage the viewer. There is an overreliance on cliche action sequences and predictable plot twists that fail to provide any real excitement or intrigue. Worst of all, the editing and direction leave much to be desired, as the story is barely strung together in a haphazard manner. In conclusion, The Mod Squad falls flat in almost every aspect. While the premise had potential, it was sadly squandered due to weak character development, lackluster acting, and generic visuals. This underwhelming crime-action film is certainly one you can pass on.

On the cusp of being insufferable, director John Doe's latest experimental film, "A Dance with Chaos," narrowly escapes the abyss of obnoxious self-indulgence. The film, centered around an eccentric artist named Vincent and his desperate quest for inspiration, walks a tightrope between creativity and lunacy. The film shines in its technical aspects, particularly its vibrant color palette and dynamic cinematography. Cinematographer Jane Smith masterfully captures the swirling chaos of Vincent's mind, his feverish attempts at creating something profound, and the moments of clarity when he does. The saving grace of "A Dance with Chaos" comes in the form of its lead actor, Tom Brilliant. Brilliant carefully avoids the caricature of the tortured artist and delivers an accessible and moving portrayal of a man on the verge of genius and madness. Through Brilliant's empathetic performance, we witness firsthand the devastation of raw talent in conflict with a lack of inspiration. However, the film's potential is bogged down by its image-heavy and dialogue-light nature. Due to this, the intended contemplative nature of the film often becomes frustrating, as certain scenes create more confusion than intended. The secondary characters, though portrayed by an ensemble of talented actors, seldom lend meaningful support to Vincent's story, often coming off as merely decorative. The absence of meaningful character interactions is more irritating than artistic, as the film would have benefitted from deeper explorations of the relationships between Vincent and his muses. Despite its shortcomings, "A Dance with Chaos" has its moments: scenes where the camera, colors, and talented cast come together to create something extraordinary. However, one can't escape the feeling that the film was merely a brushstroke away from crossing into the realm of insufferable.

It carries the tone of voice that narrates the book into the jungle of Vietnam and into the wild-eyed look of Martin Sheen and Dennis Hopper and the mystical morbidity surrounding Colonel Kurtz. (I don't say Marlon Brando because after watching the documentary, "Hearts of Darkness," I am skeptical as to how much credit Brando is due for that quality). The tone of voice I'm talking about is brooding and dramatic without being overbearing: "Everybody gets what he wants. I wanted a mission, and for my sins they gave me one. They sent it up with room service." It is indulgent without being narrow and alienating. A good example of is Hopper's indulgence into aphoristic madness, generously installing lines written by T.S. Eliot and Rudyard Kipling into his stony monologues: "I mean, the man's a geniussometimes he'll walk right by you without even saying a word, and sometimes he'll grab you by the collar and say "did you know that 'if' is the middle word in 'life'if you can hold your head while all around you they are losing theirs" and then "I mean he's a wise man, he's a great man; I should have been a pair of ragged claws scuttling across the floors of silent seas" (The first one's Kipling, the second one's Eliot.

Novak Djokovic Wins Monte Carlo Masters, Makes Tennis History MONTE CARLO - World No 1 tennis star Novak Djokovic defeated Tomas Berdych with a 7-5, 4-6, 6-3 victory in the Monte Carlo Masters on Sunday, marking a triumphant step in Djokovic's journey and breaking records in tennis history. This victory makes Djokovic the first player to win the opening three ATP World Tour Masters 1000 events of the year, after previous successes in Indian Wells and Miami. The 30-year-old Serbian athlete continues to showcase his prowess on the courts, with a current tally of 34 career Masters 1000 titles. Djokovic had to face down tough competition on his way to Sunday's victory over Berdych, having triumphed over clay court specialist Rafael Nadal in a thrilling semifinals match. Despite the difficult path to the final, Djokovic ultimately proved his dominance in the world of tennis. "I don't take anything for granted, even though I won last year in Monte-Carlo, this year I had some tough matches," Djokovic remarked after his victory. "I am very proud, as well as my team, for the achievement." Fans and analysts alike eagerly await the upcoming clay court season, where Djokovic aims to earn his first title at the French Open, the only major championship to elude him thus far. The Monte Carlo victory is a promising sign for the tennis star as he heads towards Roland Garros. "I am aware of the challenge that is ahead of me in the French Open," said Djokovic. "I am not the only one who wants to win that title, but I believe in my ability." As the 2022 clay court season begins, the world of tennis looks forward to witnessing what incredible achievements Djokovic will accomplish next.

Forget helicopters and BMWs, could the ultimate symbol of wealth be clothes made from gold? On a catwalk show which took place in Xi'an, the capital city of north-western China's Shaanxi province, models strutted their stuff in items made from the precious metal. Including underwear and a chain-mail style shirt which it has been revealed would be worth around 40,000. And this was no lightweight affair either. On a catwalk in Xi'an in China models strutted their stuff in gold underwear, it is thought the look is influenced by royal women in history . The shirt alone worn by the male model weighed in at 7lbs and the matching bra and underwear for the female model also came in at 7lbs. The idea for real gold clothing takes its inspiration from royal women in history, including Cleopatra, Marie Antoinette and Tsarina Alexandra who all reportedly had gold clothing. The organisers of the event said that it took 30 craftsmen three months to make the gold shirt and the women's clothing which is also worth around 40,000. Fashion photographer Manchu Peng, 30, who attended event said: 'There were some good designs there but the gold clothing items really stole the show.' It took 30 craftsmen three month to make this shirt which is mean out of real gold and has a chain-mail style . The model showed off his shirt as on-lookers checked out how the design was made . The idea came after a Chinese designer unveiled an extraordinary set of underwear made entirely of gold last year. The items however were produced as a work of art and not intended for sale. They were modelled by an unnamed woman who was joined by two other models - both of whom posed with glittering gold accessories, including necklaces, a shoe and a rabbit at a store in China. These two women proudly showed off their gold underwear, the items are not for sale but are said to be worth around 40,000 . This gold underwear set has an intricate design with the model wearing a pair of white pants underneath it to protect her modesty . And prior to that a Turkish jeweller unveiled a series glamorous gold dresses - each worth a staggering 85,000. Artisan Ahmet Atakan, based in Izmir, a city in Turkey, crafted each frock out of a total of 78,000 pieces of the expensive metal to form a mesh-like fabric. Despite the eye-watering price tag of 300 thousand Turkish Liras (about 84,800), eight of the unique gowns have already been sold.

Reigning champion Novak Djokovic dug deep to avoid a shock exit at the hands of Alexandr Dolgopolov before powering into the quarter-finals of the Miami Open. The unseeded Dolgopolov - ranked 65th in the world, 64 places behind Djokovic - surprised the Serbian by winning a first-set tie-break and building a quick 4-2 lead in the second set. But Djokovic steeled himself and rallied to force a decider, which he wrapped up without much resistance from his deflated Ukrainian opponent. Novak Djokovic celebrates after securing a quarter-final place at the Miami Open . Novak Djokovic came back from a set down to reach the quarter-finals of the Miami Open on Tuesday . Alexandr Dolgopolov had both of his soles bandaged and won only three points in the final set . Djokovic claimed a succession of long exchanges in the second set to even the match and go on to win . The 6-7 (37) 7-5 6-0 triumph pits the world number one against David Ferrer in the last eight after the Spaniard saw off Gilles Simon 7-6 (75) 6-0 in a little over an hour and a half. Also through to the quarters are British number one Andy Murray and fourth seed Kei Nishikori. The Scot racked up a 500th career win by edging out Kevin Anderson 6-4 3-6 6-3 to book a meeting with Austrian Dominic Thiem, a 7-6 (75) 4-6 7-5 victor against Adrian Mannarino. Nishikori of Japan made light work of David Goffin and his 6-1 6-2 sees him progress to a match-up against big-serving American John Isner, who rallied to upset fifth seed Milos Raonic 6-7 (37) 7-6 (86) 7-6 (75) in a match which last two and three-quarter hours. David Ferrer celebrates after defeating Gilles Simon to book his place in the last eight . Simon is grounded after a fall during his defeat to Ferrer, who faces Novak Djokovic next . Andy Murray was given a celebratory cake to mark 500 wins on the ATP circuit after beating Kevin Anderson . Tomas Berdych also made it through to the quarter-finals by beating Gael Monfils . Kei Nishikori is also through to the last eight, defeating Serbia's Viktor Troicki . Czech challenger Tomas Berdych reached his sixth quarter-final of the season by beating Gael Monfils 6-3 3-2. The Frenchman conceded the match by retirement after suffering a heavy fall on court, and Berdych will meet Juan Monaco following the unseeded Argentinian's 6-3 6-3 conquest of Fernando Verdasco. In the women's competition, Carla Suarez Navarro lost the first set 6-0 but hit back to see off Venus Williams 0-6 6-1 7-5 and reach the semi-finals. There she will face Germany's Andrea Petkovic after the ninth seed beat Karolina Pliskova of the Czech Republic 6-4 6-2.

In vivo D2 occupancy measurements in rats using [3Hraclopride is analogous to using [11Craclopride in human PET scanning. Suppression of CAR occurred at a D2 occupancy of around 70-75, and catalepsy at D2 occupancy 80. Results closely resembled human studies where 65-70 D2 occupancy was required for antipsychotic response, while or 80 D2 occupancy led to EPS. Brain mechanisms involved in mediation of catalepsy in rats and EPS in humans might indeed be similar. Both suppression of CAR in rats and antipsychotic response in humans might share an underlying construct, i.e. the need for around 70 D2 receptor blockade.

Despite reduced EPCs compared with healthy controls, patients with CAD respond to G-CSF with increases in EPC number and homing receptor expression in the circulation and endothelial out-growth in culture. Endothelial progenitor cells (EPCs) are reduced in coronary artery disease. Granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (CSF) administered to patients increased: (1) CD133VEGFR-2 cells consistent with EPC phenotype; (2) CD133 cells coexpressing the chemokine receptor CXCR4, important for homing of EPCs to ischemic tissue; and (3) endothelial cell-forming clusters in culture. Whether EPCs mobilized into the circulation will be useful for the purpose of initiating vascular growth and myocyte repair in coronary artery disease patients must be tested in clinical trials.

The effects on miRNAs caused by HIVSIV infection are illustrated by changes in their cellular expression throughout the course of disease, and in different patient populations. Our data demonstrate that levels of primary transcripts and mature miRs-29a, -29b, -9 and -146a are modulated by SIV infection. We show that the SIV 3' UTR contains functional miRNA response elements (MREs) for all four miRNAs. Notably, these miRNAs regulate virus production and viral RNA levels in macrophages, the primary cells infected in the CNS that drive inflammation leading to HIV-associated neurocognitive disorders. This report may aid in identification miRNAs that target viral RNAs and HIVSIV specifically, as well as in identification of miRNAs that may be targets of new therapies to treat HIV.

Ebola Test Comes Back Negative for Senior Doctor in Sierra Leone A senior doctor working in an Ebola clinic in Sierra Leone has tested negative for the deadly virus after developing flu-like symptoms on Saturday. Dr. John Parker, who had been working closely with Ebola patients in the West African clinic, was assessed at a Sydney hospital as a precautionary measure due to his recent proximity to the virus. NSW Health has confirmed that his test results for the virus have come back negative, easing concerns among health officials and staff at the Ebola clinic. Since the 2014 epidemic, Ebola has claimed the lives of over 11,000 people in West Africa, and those working in close contact with the virus are required to undergo regular health tests. Dr. Parker will continue to monitor his health as he works on the front lines of the fight against the virus.

Notable only as the acting debut of future big-time Hollywood starlet, Sandra Bullock, this ludicrous action flick is so full of holes that one might easily suspect termite infestation. A poorly executed plot and cartoonish characters consistently undermine any potential the film might have had. Though it's always a pleasure to see Bullock grace the screen, her talents are utterly wasted in this laughably absurd story. As much as the script tries to build tension and excitement, it's impossible to take anything seriously as the audience is repeatedly thrust into a whirlwind of unrealistic action sequences and a excessive barrage of explosions. The cinematography and special effects are dated and don't hold up well; the action scenes play out like an amateur's attempt at copying the thrills of slicker films in the genre. The supporting cast struggle to contend with the film's shortcomings, but their performances are ultimately overshadowed by the shoddy writing and direction. Throughout the entirety of the movie, one can't help but feel as if it's a missed opportunity - not just for Sandra Bullock's acting prowess, but for what could have been an interesting concept if set in more capable hands. In conclusion, this film is best left as a curious footnote in Bullock's illustrious career. Save yourself the time and go watch one of her later, much better vehicles where her screen presence and talent shine. This failed action flick holds nothing more than the painful reminder that even future big-time Hollywood starlets had to start somewhere.

Person1: You should have seen the line at the housing office. It took me an hour to make my dormitory deposit for next year. Have you made yours yet? Person2: No, I'm not sure I'm going to. Person1: There's not much time left. The deadline's May 1. That is just two weeks from now. Are you short of cash? Person2: No, I'm Okay. Person1: You'd better hurry up if you want a dorm room next September. There aren't enough rooms for every one, and first year students have priority. Person2: Well, I've been thinking about living off campus. Person1: Have you any idea of how much that would cost? There is the rent, utilities, and you'd probably need a car. Person2: I know it would be more expensive. I think I can handle it though. The dorm is just so noisy that I can't get anything done. Maybe my grades would be better if I had some peace and quiet in a place of my own. Person1: You should study in the library the way I do. Think of the money you'd save. Person2: I've got to think it over some more. There's still two weeks left in April.

The results indicate that the aqueous humor is capable of producing levels of H2O2 that have been shown previously to cause cataract in organ culture. Changes in aqueous humor metal ion content and concentration of oxygen level have profound effects on H2O2 concentration and may effect lens viability. The variation in published H2O2 levels may in part be the result of the conditions under which the aqueous humor was obtained, stored, and used for assay. The observed steady state H2O2 concentration of 1 microM in fresh aqueous from bovine eyes must be maintained by the metabolism of surrounding tissues as well as intrinsic components capable of degrading H2O2.

From the weeks and weeks of promotion for this, ABC's "The One" was supposed to be "The Real World" meets "American Idol." Although there was some hesitation, given the amount of past reality TV flops, it is safe to say that the makers of "The One" actually managed to combine the best elements of both shows, creating a fresh and engaging reality TV experience. "The One" centers around a group of talented and diverse individuals who are brought together under one roof to compete in a singing competition. The show does a fantastic job of balancing the drama of interpersonal relationships with the excitement of high-stakes performances. The contestants display admirable vulnerability as they expose their true selves to the world, creating a sense of authenticity that fans of reality television will truly appreciate. The show's producers also did a great job of finding a star-studded panel of judges who, much like those of "American Idol," treat contestants with support, respect, and occasional tough love. This dynamic is a refreshing change of pace from other singing competitions and adds to the overall entertainment value of the series. One of the best aspects of "The One" is the fantastic array of musical genres and themes that the contestants dive into. Unlike "American Idol," which often sticks to the safer side of pop culture, "The One" embraces the daring and displays outstanding performances in styles such as rock, RB, country, and even some international sounds. This offers great variety, week after week, keeping the viewer constantly entertained and engaged. "The One" might not reinvent the reality TV wheel or be entirely immune to the occasional cliche, but it does find a way to refresh the established formula and bring something fresh to reality television fans. The drama is tolerable, the talent is impressive, and the show is a fun ride for fans of singing competitions and with a taste for interpersonal conflict. In the end, "The One" lives up to the hype and cements itself as a worthy addition to the reality TV landscape.

I picked this DVD up for 3.99 at Rogers Video in order to get enough points to get a better movie for free. To my pleasant surprise, "Bargain Bin Bonanza" turned out to be quite the hidden gem. As the title suggests, it follows a group of eccentric, down-on-their-luck strangers who are united by their quest to find gold in the unlikeliest of places: the discount bin of a local video store. Featuring quirky twists and turns along with a solid ensemble cast that boasts a number of surprisingly endearing performances, this indie comedy-drama provided much-needed levity and heart. While the film initially seemed to hinge on the irony of its premise, it quickly transformed into a tale of friendship, hope, and the power of shared passions. Cinematography-wise, the film also stood out with an understated style that celebrates the familiar, nostalgic charm of suburban America. The soundtrack cleverly mixed iconic tunes from the classic movies featured within the story, effectively amplifying the characters' love for film and playing into the shared sentimentality of movie buffs in the audience. "Bargain Bin Bonanza" certainly isn't without its flaws - the pacing occasionally falters, and the film veers dangerously close to predictability at times. However, its offbeat charm, earnest storytelling, and lively characters more than make up for these shortcomings, resulting in a delightful viewing experience that leaves you with a warm, fuzzy feeling. In summary, while I initially picked up "Bargain Bin Bonanza" with the intention of merely scoring extra points for a free movie, I unwittingly discovered a delightful, heartwarming gem that I now hold dear. It's a wonderful reminder that sometimes, the best treasures can be found in the most unexpected places - and for 3.99, it's definitely worth giving a chance.

Person1: Sounds great, thank you so much, Maggie! I really appreciate it. Person2: No problem, happy to help. See you at lunch then!

The tibia first technique with tensor measurement can be useful in predicting the soft tissue tension after implantation in unicompartmental knee arthroplasty (UKA). The technique involves using a tensor to measure the ligament balance and correct any varusvalgus alignment of the knee while performing the tibial cut. This technique aims to restore the native soft tissue tension of the knee joint after joint replacement surgery. Several studies have demonstrated the importance of accurate ligament balancing and proper soft tissue tension for the overall success, function, and durability of UKAs. The tibia first technique with tensor measurement allows the surgeon to adjust the implant position and soft tissue tension to achieve a more balanced and better-functioning knee joint. This, in turn, may lead to a more successful outcome and improved patient satisfaction. However, more research and clinical studies are needed to determine the overall effectiveness of the tibia first technique in predicting the precise soft tissue tension following UKA, as well as the potential impact of various surgical approaches, implant designs, and individual patient factors on soft tissue tension and overall joint function.

Secondary operators, typically trauma surgery attendings, traumacritical care fellows, or senior surgical residents, function as mentors in academic institutions and act as role models. Secondary operators participated in many of the studied cases, yet failed to demonstrate consistent use of MBP. In elective central venous catheter placement, those where there was the greatest opportunity to follow MBP, we observed a statistically significant difference in compliance rate between the primary and secondary operators. The study suggests the need to address the performance of the secondary operators and to educate them, as although they may be technically experienced in placing central venous catheters, they may comply less consistently with MBP.

Developing a kidney transplantation program using the inverted funnel approach involves starting with a broad perspective and gradually narrowing it down to specifics. Here is a step-by-step guide to establishing a kidney transplantation program using this approach: 1. Define the scope and goals: Start by identifying the primary goals and objectives of the kidney transplantation program, such as increasing the number of transplants performed, improving patient outcomes, and expanding access to care. Determine the necessary resources and infrastructure to support these goals, taking into account factors such as staffing, funding, and facilities. 2. Research and analyze existing programs: Examine existing kidney transplantation programs, both nationally and internationally. Identify best practices and successful models that can be adapted for your program, as well as any potential challenges or barriers that may need to be addressed. 3. Engage stakeholders: Establish relationships with key stakeholders, including transplant centers, nephrologists, patients, donor organizations, and regulatory authorities. Involve them in the planning and development process to ensure that their perspectives are considered and to foster collaboration. 4. Develop a strategic plan: Based on your research, stakeholder input, and identified goals, create a comprehensive strategic plan that outlines the steps necessary to establish and maintain a successful kidney transplantation program. This plan should outline specific objectives, timelines, and milestones, as well as the roles and responsibilities of all involved parties. 5. Implement the program: Begin implementing the kidney transplantation program according to the strategic plan, making any necessary adjustments based on feedback and available resources. This may include hiring staff, establishing partnerships, acquiring equipment, and developing educational and outreach campaigns. 6. Monitor and evaluate progress: Regularly track and analyze key performance indicators, such as the number of transplants performed, patient outcomes, and program growth. Use this information to refine and improve the program. 7. Build partnerships: Develop and maintain relationships with other organizations and professionals in the transplantation field, including collaborations with other transplant centers, networking with professionals, and participating in conferences and research initiatives. 8. Advocate for improved kidney transplant policies: Work with stakeholders and policymakers to advocate for improved policies and public awareness around kidney transplantation, such as increasing organ donor registrations and promoting living donor transplants. 9. Continuous improvement: Ensure that the kidney transplantation program remains up-to-date with the latest clinical advancements and technologies, and continually adapts and refines its processes to maximize patient outcomes and efficiency. By following this inverted funnel approach, a kidney transplantation program can be established in a systematic and logical manner, with a focus on achieving the program's specific goals while taking into account the needs and perspectives of all stakeholders.

Rare African Cat Gives Birth to Three Cubs at Columbus Zoo The Columbus Zoo in Ohio has welcomed an incredibly rare Amur tiger cub trio into the world. Ten-year-old Irisa, the mother of the cubs, was confirmed pregnant earlier this spring after several unsuccessful breeding attempts. The birth was smooth, with each of the cubs weighing 2.5 pounds at birth. The newborns are expected to grow to 650 pounds each. Zookeepers at the Columbus Zoo reported that while Irisa had bred before, she had never successfully conceived. The successful pregnancy and multiple births were a pleasant surprise to zoo staff. The zoo's animal husbandry team was involved in the breeding program that helped Irisa carry the three cubs to term. However, all was not without complications: zookeepers found that Irisa failed to show any maternal care for her newborn cubs. As a result, the staff stepped in, and the babies are now being hand-reared in incubators by the zoo's experienced animal care team. While it's still early days for the new additions to the zoo, the cubs are said to be doing well, thanks to the dedicated team at the Columbus Zoo. As they continue to grow, the trio will be given enrichment items and appropriate care to ensure their health and happiness. "We are extremely proud and excited to announce the birth of the Amur tiger Cubs," said Columbus Zoo President and CEO, Tom Stalf. "Our dedicated team continues to provide these cubs with the best care possible in order to ensure their survival and help them thrive. The cubs are doing well, and we look forward to watching them grow." The birth of these three rare Amur tiger cubs is significant for the species' survival. Amur tigers, native to Asia, are endangered, with between 360 and 470 animals estimated to remain in the wild. Habitat loss, poaching, and human-wildlife conflict are some of the primary factors contributing to the decline in the Amur tiger population. The Columbus Zoo is involved in the Association of Zoos and Aquariums' (AZA) Species Survival Plan (SSP) for Amur tigers. The primary goal of this program is to establish healthy, genetically diverse populations of tigers within accredited institutions to serve as an insurance population and source for potential reintroduction efforts in the future. The birth of these three cubs is a milestone for the AZA's program, as it marks a significant step forward in the ongoing effort to protect Amur tigers and ensure their continued existence.
